info.description: Hexblade but more focused on their weapon and without all that pesky spellcasting. They choose a weapon like spell to focus on. Such as Vampiric Touch or Flame Blade.

As an Eldritch Glaive, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d10 per Eldritch Glaive level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per Eldritch Glaive level after 1st
Armor: Light armor, medium armor, shields
Weapons: Simple weapons, martial weapons
Tools: None
Saving Throws: Wisdom, Charisma
Skills: Choose two skills from Arcana, Deception, History, Intimidation, Investigation, Nature, and Religion.

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any martial weapon
(a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) a scholar’s pack or (b) a dungeoneer’s pack
(a) Leather armor or (b) scale mail
any simple weapon, and two daggers

setters.set: Aa class based around the concept of the Hexblade but more focused on their weapon and without all that pesky spellcasting. They choose a weapon like spell to focus on. Such as Vampiric Touch or Flame Blade.
Light armor, medium armor, shields, simple weapons, martial weapons, one skill from the class’s skill list

description.p: At 1st level, … some kind of archetype ability, WIP. Your choice grants you features at 1st level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

Your variant of the hexblade warlock bond with their weapon is particularly strong, granting you abilities beyond other hexblades, at the expense of the warlocks spellcasting ability. As you level you gain Hex slots that recharge on a short rest and automatically scale with your level as listed in the Hex level chart. These slots can power some of your abilities and invocations. They cannot be used to cast spells like other warlocks, nor can they be used to fuel Paladin Smites or Sorcerer Sorcerery Points.

Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your warlock spells, so you use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a warlock spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

sheet.description: These slots can power some of your abilities and invocations. They cannot be used to cast spells like other warlocks, nor can they be used to fuel Paladin Smites or Sorcerer Sorcerery Points.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you gain the ability to Focus upon a target. As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target is becomes your Focus target until the target dies, you die, or you are incapacitated. It also ends on the target if you use another bonus action to Focus upon another target. Until the Focus ends, you gain the following benefits:
You gain a bonus to damage rolls against the Focused target. The bonus equals your proficiency bonus.
Any attack roll you make against the Focused target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
You deal an extra 1d6, nontyped magical, damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack.
Choose one ability when you use this feature, the target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.
If the Focused target dies, you regain hit points equal to your eldritch glavie level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).
You gain a bonus to damage rolls against the Focused target. The bonus equals your proficiency bonus.
You gain a bonus to damage rolls against the Focused target. The bonus equals your proficiency bonus.

At 1st level you gain the ability to bond with your weapon. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch one weapon that you are proficient with and that lacks the two-handed property. When you attack with that weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier {{charisma:modifier}}, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls. This benefit lasts until you finish a long rest. When you later gain the Pact of the Blade feature, this benefit extends to every pact weapon you conjure with that feature, no matter the weapon’s type.

sheet.description: Make a bond with one weapon you are proficient with. Attacks with that weapon do {{hex warrior:damage}} damage.

description.p: In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed eldritch invocations, fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding magical ability.

At 2nd level, you gain two eldritch invocations of your choice. Your invocation options are detailed at the end of the class description. When you gain certain warlock levels, you gain additional invocations of your choice, as shown in the Invocations Known column of the Warlock table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the invocations you know and replace it with another invocation that you could learn at that level.

At 3rd level you can use your action to create a pact weapon in your empty hand. You weave together threads of ether to create a weapon in your hand. It deals 2d4 magical bludgeoning, slashing or piercing damage, depending on weapon type, on a hit.

You can transform one magic weapon into your pact weapon by performing a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. You can then dismiss the weapon, shunting it into an extradimensional space, and it appears whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. You can’t affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks. You can still change the shape of your Pact Weapon, and it still does the same damage based off of level, but it gains any properties of the magic weapon such as +1 or Flaming.

If you drop the weapon or throw it, it dissipates at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the ability persists, you can use a bonus action to cause the weapon to reappear in your hand. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die.

You can choose the form that this melee weapon takes each time you create it (see the Weapons section for weapon options). You are proficient with it while you wield it. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

The Pact Weapon’s damage increases as you gain levels, based off the Hex Level. When your Hex Level is 3rd or 4th level the damage increases to 3d4. At 5th or 6th Hex levels the damage increases to 4d4. And when your Hex level is 7th or higher the damage increases to 5d4.

At 3rd level, when you take this Weapon of the Glaive, you gain a new option for your Pact Weapon. Now when you use your Pact Weapon feature you can call forth necrotic shadows to shroud your hands, possibly taking the form of deadly life-siphoning claws. When you use your Pact Weapon this way you instead deal 3d6 necrotic damage. You heal for half the damage your Touch does. At 7th level, when your Hex Level increases to 4, the damage increases by 1d6. It increases by another 1d6 for each Hex Level beyond 4th.

Beginning at 3rd level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Strength modifier + your Charisma modifier. This AC value increases by +1 at 6th, 12th and 18th levels.
Starting at 7th level you can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check, or using your hands. This works as Spider Climb.
You also gain Darkvision of 120 feet, this darkvision works even in magical darkness.

Starting at 15th level, you gain the ability to sprout a pair of bat wings from your back, gaining a flying speed equal to your current speed. You can create these wings as a bonus action on your turn. They last until you dismiss them as a bonus action on your turn.
You can’t manifest your wings while wearing armor unless the armor is made to accommodate them, and clothing not made to accommodate your wings might be destroyed when you manifest them.
At 20th level, you gain the ability to infuse your entire body with the power of your Vampiric Touch. This can be a visible change, but it does not need to be.

Regeneration: You regain 20 hit points at the start of your turn if you have at least 1 hit point and aren’t in sunlight or running water. If you take radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of your next turn.
Your Vampiric Touch attacks now add your Strength modifier, in addition to your Charisma modifier, to their damage rolls.
Your Darkvision now allows you to see through Darkness and Magical Darkness as well as you can see through daylight.

description.p: At 3rd level, when you take this Weapon of the Glaive, you gain a new option for your Pact Weapon. Now when you use your Pact Weapon feature you can call forth primordial flames. You can form any shape of weapon with fire instead of ether. When you use your Pact Weapon this way you instead deal 3d6 fire damage. The flaming blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. And the Flame Blade has the light and finesse traits. At 7th level, when your Hex Level increases to 4, the damage increases by 1d6. It increases by another 1d6 for every two Hex Levels beyond 4th.
At third level you become resistant to Fire Damage. You do not suffer Exhaustion or similar penalties from hot or cold conditions.

Additionally when you take damage from a creature within 60ft of you you can, as a Reaction, cause flames to lash out from you that creature. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 2d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. At higher levels this damage increases by 1d10 for each Hex Level beyond 2nd.
Starting at 7th level your speed increases by 10 feet, this increases by another ten feet at 12th and 17th levels.
Your body now sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light in an additional 20 feet.

Also at 7th level you gain the ability to channel the power of your Flame Blade through your body and into the air around you. As a bonus action you can activate an Aura of Flame, which remains active until you fall unconscious or spend another bonus action to end it. While this Aura of Flame is active a creature that touches you or hits you with a melee attack while within 5 feet of you takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. At 12th level the Aura increases. The damage it deals is now 10 (2d10) Fire damage. Also any creature that comes within 15 feet of you, or ends its turn within that area, also takes the Aura’s damage. At 17th level the Aura improves again. The damage increases to 15 (3d10) fire damage, and the area of the aura now expands to 30 feet.
Starting at 15th level you become immune to Fire damage and resistant to poison damage.

In addition you have gained a greater control of your Aura of Flame. Your Aura of Flame now only harms creatures of your choice, instead of all creatures in its area. Your greater control also seems to make it difficult for the affected creatures to leave your aura. Any creatures that you choose to have affected by your Aura have their speed halved while in your aura as the winds seem to howl toward your fiery center.
At 20th level the primordial flame of your Flame Blade fully infuses you. This can be a visible change, but it does not need to be.

Dual Wielding: When you create a Flame Blade you can now make a pair of Flame Blades. The second weapon can be used to make an attack as a bonus action using the two-weapon fighting rules.

description.p: At 3rd level, when you take this Weapon of the Glaive, you gain a new option for your Pact Weapon. Now when you use your Pact Weapon feature you weave together threads of shadow to create a weapon of solidified gloom in your hand. While using your Pact Weapon this way it deals 2d8 psychic damage on a hit and has the finesse, light and thrown properties (range 20/60). In addition, when you use the weapon to attack a target in dim light or darkness, you make the attack roll with advantage. If you drop the weapon or throw it, it dissipates at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause the weapon to reappear in your hand. If you have the Thirsting Blade invocation and throw the weapon you can have it reappear in your hand in time to make your second attack as part of your attack action without needing to use a bonus action to call it back to your hand.
At 5th level, when your Hex Level increases to 3, the damage increases by 1d8. It increases by another 1d8 for every two Hex Levels beyond 3rd.
At 3rd level you gain the Armor of Shadows and Devil’s Sight invocations. If you already had one or more of them you can retrain your previous invocation selections into another invocation.

Additionally when you take damage from a creature within 60ft of you you can, as a Reaction, cause flames to lash out from you that creature. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 2d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. At higher levels this damage increases by 1d10 for each Hex Level beyond 2nd.

Starting at 7th level you can, as a bonus action, cause flame-like shadows to wreathe your body until you fall unconscious or use another bonus action to end the effect, causing you to become heavily obscured to others. The shadows turn dim light within 10 feet of you into darkness, and bright light in the same area to dim light.

While under this effect, you have resistance to radiant damage. In addition, whenever a creature within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack, the shadows lash out at that creature, dealing it 2d8 necrotic damage.
You now have Expertise in Stealth, if you were already proficient in Stealth you can retrain to another skill.

Starting at 15th level, you gain the ability to step from one shadow into another. When you are in dim light or darkness, as a bonus action you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness. You then have advantage on the first melee attack you make before the end of the turn.

In addition a veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. Each creature of your choice, including yourself, has a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can’t be tracked except by magical means. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.
At 20th level, you gain the ability to infuse your entire body with the shadows you weave. This can be a visible change, but it does not need to be.

ul.li: Damage Resistance: You have resistance to Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks. You have immunity to Necrotic and Poison damage. You are immune to the Exhaustion, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained conditions.

You have a Passive Stealth score of 15+your Stealth skill. You can choose to suppress this, but otherwise are always considered to have rolled a 15 on a d20 for a Stealth check. If you wish you can roll for Stealth, but any roll of 14 or below instead counts as a 15, thus not allowing you to get a result below your passive stealth.
Amorphous: You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
You can choose to radiate an aura of magical darkness up to 120 feet from you, creatures of your choice can see through this magical darkness as if they benefited from Devil’s Sight.
Your Darkvision now has no range limitation, this allows you to see through Darkness and Magical Darkness as well as you can see through day.
